comments.body: What's the motivation behind not including the traceback in some cases - I guess to avoid returning server-internal stacktraces to the end user in scoring use cases? Could we document this param?

As I was trying out this workflow, I realized that a perfectly good error message like "you're missing this column" was overwhelmed by stack trace information. As a user, I really don't need that stack trace if the error message is good.

So I opted to have MlflowExceptions (which are places where we explicitly throw an error) avoid including the stack trace in the response to keep it cleaner and easier to read.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +138,142 @@    :param include_traceback: Whether to include the current traceback in the returned error.
    """
    if include_traceback:
        traceback_buf = StringIO()
        traceback.print_exc(file=traceback_buf)
